metadata.name: Japan Briefing
metadata.description: Daily news briefing for the NYT Tokyo Bureau Chief

all.headline: 各地で気温上昇 落雪や雪崩 除雪中の事故など十分注意
all.description: 立春の4日は広い範囲で気温が上がっています。平年を上回る積雪となっている地域では、屋根からの落雪や雪崩、除雪作業中の事故などに十分注意をしてください。

all.headline: 退職代行事件 弁護士側と覚書交わし3年前から依頼者を紹介か
all.description: 退職代行サービス「モームリ」を運営する会社の社長ら2人が、依頼者を弁護士に紹介して違法に報酬を得ていたとして弁護士法違反の疑いで逮捕された事件で、会社側が、弁護士側から紹介料を受け取るとする覚書を交わしたうえで、3年前から依頼者を紹介していたとみられることが捜査関係者への取材で分かりました。2人は容疑を否認しているということです。

all.headline: 東京 新宿 学童クラブで男児にわいせつ行為か 保育士逮捕
all.description: 東京 新宿区の学童クラブに勤めていた40歳の男の保育士が、宿泊を伴う行事で、当時小学生だった男の子の体を触るなどのわいせつな行為をしたとして逮捕されたことが、捜査関係者への取材で分かりました。この学童クラブと、保育士が現在勤める保育園では、保護者から同じような被害の相談が数十件寄せられているということで、警視庁が関連を調べています。

all.headline: 安倍元首相銃撃事件 山上被告の弁護団が控訴 判決不服として
all.description: 4年前、奈良市で安倍元総理大臣を銃撃したとして殺人などの罪に問われ、無期懲役の判決を言い渡された山上徹也被告の弁護団が4日、判決を不服として控訴しました。

all.headline: 米軍 “アラビア海の空母に接近のイラン無人機を撃墜”
all.description: アメリカ軍はアラビア海に展開する空母に接近したイランの無人機を撃墜したと明らかにしました。アメリカとイランは高官による協議を控えており、ホワイトハウスは現時点では予定どおり行われる見通しを示していますが、高官協議が実現し、緊張緩和につながるかが焦点です。

all.headline: プルデンシャル生命 新規契約の販売活動を90日間自粛
all.description: 営業社員が顧客から金銭をだまし取るなど31億円にのぼる不適切な金銭の受領が判明したプルデンシャル生命は、2月9日から新規契約の販売活動を90日間、自粛すると発表しました。ガバナンス態勢や営業制度の抜本的な見直しを最優先に実施するためだとしています。

all.headline: 衆院選 投票所などのアルバイト 派遣会社は人手確保に追われる
all.description: 今回の衆議院選挙が「超短期決戦」となった影響で、都内の人材派遣会社では投票所や開票所で作業にあたる人手の確保に追われています。

all.headline: JAL says passenger revenue in December was 20% short for China routes
all.description: The drop was attributed to Beijing advice to Chinese citizens to refrain from traveling to Japan.

all.headline: Taiwan military capabilities in jeopardy as defense budget row deepens
all.description: The dispute over a bill that would slash by 70% a DPP-backed defense spending request has prompted unease in both Taipei and Washington.

all.headline: Is this election really unpredictable?
all.description: Despite media uncertainty, opposition weaknesses and recent polls suggest Takaichi and the LDP are likely headed for a strong victory.

all.headline: Arteta backs Arsenal to build on 'magical' place in League Cup final
all.description: It was a cathartic triumph for the Gunners, who had lost their previous four semifinals.

all.headline: Fuji Media shares drop as buyback plan heralds activist exit
all.description: Under the plan, Fuji Media will repurchase up to ¥235 billion of its own shares.

all.headline: Takaichi seen avoiding discussing plan to cut Lower House seats
all.description: The prime minister seeming to avoid discussing the Lower House seat-cut proposal now is believed to reflect concerns within the Liberal Democratic Party about it, observers said.

all.headline: CRA heavyweights’ heated contests allude to party’s uphill struggle in Sunday’s vote
all.description: Yukio Edano, Jun Azumi and Ichiro Ozawa are among candidates facing neck-and-neck races in their home turfs.

all.headline: Clippers trade Harden to Cavaliers for Garland as deadline nears
all.description: News of the Harden deal came amid a flurry of reported moves on Tuesday.

all.headline: Refiner Eneos to expand oil-trading portfolio outside of Japan
all.description: Eneos beefing up its trading presence is part of a broader push to create more value across business sectors as oil markets kicked off the year with a high level of volatility.

all.headline: LDP executive seeks to leave slush fund scandal behind
all.description: Koichi Hagiuda was among the five leading figures of the now-defunct LDP faction once led by the late Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, which was at the center of the scandal.

all.headline: UK Police Open Criminal Investigation into Politician Peter Mandelson over Alleged Leaks to Epstein
all.description: LONDON (AP) — British police on Tuesday opened a criminal investigation into politician Peter Mandelson over alleged misconduct in public office related to his relationship with convicted sex offender

all.headline: Japan’s Nikkei Stock Average Slips after Sharp Gain, Tech Shares Weigh
all.description: TOKYO, Feb 4 (Reuters) - Japan's Nikkei share average fell on Wednesday, after a sharp gain in the previous session, weighed down by heavy technology stocks that tracked Wall Street's lower.

all.headline: New York, New Jersey Sue Trump Administration over Tunnel Funding Halt
all.description: WASHINGTON, Feb 3 - New York and New Jersey late on Tuesday sued the Trump administration seeking an emergency court order to force the restoration of funding for the massive $16 billion Hudson River

all.headline: 90-Year-Old Mother of Abductee Laments Lack of Progress

all.headline: Hunting for Small Details in PokéPark KANTO, Keep a Sharp Eye Out at All Times
all.description: PokéPark KANTO’s creation certainly involved a great deal of care and attention to detail, as little nods to series can be found everywhere.

all.headline: Palestinian Women Describe ‘Journey of Horror’ Crossing Back into Gaza
all.description: CAIRO/GAZA, Feb 3 (Reuters) - Palestinian women among the few people let back into Gaza after Israel's delayed reopening of the Rafah crossing under last year's ceasefire have described being blindfol

all.description: Feb 3 (Reuters) - The U.S. military on Tuesday shot down an Iranian drone that "aggressively" approached the Abraham Lincoln aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea, the U.S. military said, in an incident

all.headline: Green Tea Exports Hit Record High in 2025 Amid Growing Demand, Likely to Be Driving Force Behind Govt Export Target
all.description: Exports of green tea, including matcha, reached a record high of more than 10,000 tons last year, according to trade statistics released by the Finance Ministry.

all.headline: Astronomers Unveil Map of Dark Matter’s Distribution
all.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) — Using observations from the James Webb Space Telescope in a patch of the sky covering almost three times the area of the full moon, scientists have created the most detailed cos

all.headline: Tokyo Had 65,000 More People Move In Than Out In 2025; Osaka Area Also Saw Gains
all.description: Tokyo had a net migration gain of 65,219 people in 2025, but the margin declined by 14,066 people from the previous year, marking the first decline in four years, according to a government report rele

all.headline: 'Never imagined this': Indian village grapples with interfaith couple's killing
all.description: Police say they were beaten to death, allegedly by the woman's three brothers, who have been arrested.

all.headline: Rights groups say China detained two journalists over corruption report
all.description: Liu Hu and Wu Yingjiao have been reportedly detained after exposing corruption by a senior official in Sichuan.

all.headline: 'I don't think I am a hero': Boy, 13, describes 'superhuman' swim to save family
all.description: Austin Applebee recounts his 'superhuman' swim which saved the lives of his mother and siblings in Australia.

all.headline: The Chinese planemaker taking on Boeing and Airbus
all.description: Comac's passenger jet is attracting customers in South East Asia where demand for affordable aircraft is growing.

all.headline: Hope and uncertainty as India and US strike long-delayed trade deal
all.description: Indian industry has welcomed lower tariffs, but experts caution against celebration until details are clearer.

all.headline: No defect found in switch of jet grounded by Air India - regulator
all.description: The Boeing 787-8 jet was grounded after a pilot reported a possible issue with the fuel control switch.

all.headline: US and India reach trade deal, Trump says after Modi call
all.description: Tariffs will drop from 50% to 18% on Indian goods, while India has agreed to stop buying Russian oil.

all.headline: China bans hidden car door handles over safety concerns
all.description: It makes China the first country to stop the use of designs first made popular by Elon Musk's Tesla.

all.headline: 'Superhuman' teen swims hours to save family stranded off Australian coast
all.description: The 13-year-old swam 4km in rough water after his mother and siblings were swept out to sea off the coast of Western Australia.

all.headline: Beijing criticises Dalai Lama Grammy win as 'manipulation'
all.description: The Buddhist spiritual leader is recognised in the audiobook category for his meditations.

all.headline: How Indonesia's new sex laws will affect tourists
all.description: International travelers have been flocking back to the popular resort island of Bali as the Covid pandemic subsides, prompting hopes that Indonesia's battered tourism industry is on the road to recove

all.headline: Afghanistan
North Korea
This 'edible' plastic bag alternative could save Nara's sacred deer
all.description: A local entrepreneur in the Japanese tourist destination of Nara has developed an alternative to plastic shopping bags, to protect the town's sacred deer.

all.headline: The battle to save Sri Lanka's leopards
all.description: Having endured a bloody civil war from 1983 until 2009, Sri Lanka is now at peace and developing rapidly. That's good news for the country as a whole, but the island nation's leopards are under threat

all.headline: Wildlife is flourishing around Fukushima
all.description: Nearly a decade after Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster, researchers have discovered that wildlife is thriving in the areas evacuated by humans, despite radiological contamination.

all.headline: China debuts 620 kph train prototype
all.description: China has revealed a prototype for a new high-speed Maglev train that is capable of reaching speeds of 620 kilometers (385 miles) per hour.

all.headline: A Shanghai building 'walks' to a new location
all.description: Shanghai residents passing through the city's eastern Huangpu district in October might have stumbled upon an unusual sight: a "walking" building.

all.headline: Self-driving robotaxis are taking off in China
all.description: The world has been inching toward fully autonomous cars for years. In China, one company just got even closer to making it a reality.

all.headline: Travel to Japan during Covid-19: What you need to know
all.description: If you're planning a trip to Japan, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the global coronavirus pandemic.

primary.headline: 各地で気温上昇 落雪や雪崩 除雪中の事故など十分注意
primary.description: 立春の4日は広い範囲で気温が上がっています。平年を上回る積雪となっている地域では、屋根からの落雪や雪崩、除雪作業中の事故などに十分注意をしてください。

primary.headline: 退職代行事件 弁護士側と覚書交わし3年前から依頼者を紹介か
primary.description: 退職代行サービス「モームリ」を運営する会社の社長ら2人が、依頼者を弁護士に紹介して違法に報酬を得ていたとして弁護士法違反の疑いで逮捕された事件で、会社側が、弁護士側から紹介料を受け取るとする覚書を交わしたうえで、3年前から依頼者を紹介していたとみられることが捜査関係者への取材で分かりました。2人は容疑を否認しているということです。

primary.headline: 東京 新宿 学童クラブで男児にわいせつ行為か 保育士逮捕
primary.description: 東京 新宿区の学童クラブに勤めていた40歳の男の保育士が、宿泊を伴う行事で、当時小学生だった男の子の体を触るなどのわいせつな行為をしたとして逮捕されたことが、捜査関係者への取材で分かりました。この学童クラブと、保育士が現在勤める保育園では、保護者から同じような被害の相談が数十件寄せられているということで、警視庁が関連を調べています。

primary.headline: 安倍元首相銃撃事件 山上被告の弁護団が控訴 判決不服として
primary.description: 4年前、奈良市で安倍元総理大臣を銃撃したとして殺人などの罪に問われ、無期懲役の判決を言い渡された山上徹也被告の弁護団が4日、判決を不服として控訴しました。

primary.headline: 米軍 “アラビア海の空母に接近のイラン無人機を撃墜”
primary.description: アメリカ軍はアラビア海に展開する空母に接近したイランの無人機を撃墜したと明らかにしました。アメリカとイランは高官による協議を控えており、ホワイトハウスは現時点では予定どおり行われる見通しを示していますが、高官協議が実現し、緊張緩和につながるかが焦点です。

primary.headline: プルデンシャル生命 新規契約の販売活動を90日間自粛
primary.description: 営業社員が顧客から金銭をだまし取るなど31億円にのぼる不適切な金銭の受領が判明したプルデンシャル生命は、2月9日から新規契約の販売活動を90日間、自粛すると発表しました。ガバナンス態勢や営業制度の抜本的な見直しを最優先に実施するためだとしています。

primary.headline: 衆院選 投票所などのアルバイト 派遣会社は人手確保に追われる
primary.description: 今回の衆議院選挙が「超短期決戦」となった影響で、都内の人材派遣会社では投票所や開票所で作業にあたる人手の確保に追われています。

primary.headline: JAL says passenger revenue in December was 20% short for China routes
primary.description: The drop was attributed to Beijing advice to Chinese citizens to refrain from traveling to Japan.

primary.headline: Taiwan military capabilities in jeopardy as defense budget row deepens
primary.description: The dispute over a bill that would slash by 70% a DPP-backed defense spending request has prompted unease in both Taipei and Washington.

primary.headline: Is this election really unpredictable?
primary.description: Despite media uncertainty, opposition weaknesses and recent polls suggest Takaichi and the LDP are likely headed for a strong victory.

primary.headline: Arteta backs Arsenal to build on 'magical' place in League Cup final
primary.description: It was a cathartic triumph for the Gunners, who had lost their previous four semifinals.

primary.headline: Fuji Media shares drop as buyback plan heralds activist exit
primary.description: Under the plan, Fuji Media will repurchase up to ¥235 billion of its own shares.

primary.headline: Takaichi seen avoiding discussing plan to cut Lower House seats
primary.description: The prime minister seeming to avoid discussing the Lower House seat-cut proposal now is believed to reflect concerns within the Liberal Democratic Party about it, observers said.

primary.description: Yukio Edano, Jun Azumi and Ichiro Ozawa are among candidates facing neck-and-neck races in their home turfs.

primary.description: Eneos beefing up its trading presence is part of a broader push to create more value across business sectors as oil markets kicked off the year with a high level of volatility.

primary.description: PokéPark KANTO’s creation certainly involved a great deal of care and attention to detail, as little nods to series can be found everywhere.

primary.headline: Green Tea Exports Hit Record High in 2025 Amid Growing Demand, Likely to Be Driving Force Behind Govt Export Target
primary.description: Exports of green tea, including matcha, reached a record high of more than 10,000 tons last year, according to trade statistics released by the Finance Ministry.

screenshots.name: Takaichi Sanae
tweets:
Ramchandra Paudel, President of Nepal, a South Asian country surrounded by the Himalayas.
@OOP_Nepal
We welcomed him to the Prime Minister's Office and held a meeting with him.

This year marks the 70th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Japan and Nepal. I agreed with President Podel to further develop the friendly relationship between our two countries that has been built over many years.

I visited Urawa Ward, Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture with the support of Hideki Murai, an official member of the Liberal Democratic Party.
The support for Hideki Murai from everyone in Saitama Ward 1 (Minuma Ward, Urawa Ward, Midori Ward, Saitama City) will be the strength of me, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for Hideki Murai!

We will continue to deliver measures against high prices to Saitama Prefecture!

I visited Tokorozawa City, Saitama Prefecture with the support of Masahiko Shibayama, an official of the Liberal Democratic Party.
The support for Masahiko Shibayama from everyone in Saitama's 8th Ward (Tokorozawa City, Fujimino City, and Miyoshi Town, Iruma District) will be my strength, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for “Masahiko Shibayama”!

We will continue to deliver measures against high prices to Saitama Prefecture!

I visited Kawagoe City, Saitama Prefecture with the support of Hideyuki Nakano, who is officially recognized by the Liberal Democratic Party.
The support for Hideyuki Nakano from everyone in Saitama 7th Ward (Kawagoe City, Fujimi City) will be my strength, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for “Hideyuki Nakano”!

We will continue to deliver measures against high prices to Saitama Prefecture!

I visited Higashimatsuyama City, Saitama Prefecture with the support of Susumu Yamaguchi, an official member of the Liberal Democratic Party.
The support for Susumu Yamaguchi from everyone in Saitama's 10 wards (Higashimatsuyama City, Sakado City, Tsurugashima City, Hiki District) will be the strength of me, Sanae Takaichi.
Please leave your vote for “Susumu Yamaguchi”!

We will continue to deliver measures against high prices to Saitama Prefecture!
